string.text: 15 round magazine for the M1A1 Carbine, chambered for .30-60 Springfield.\n The M1 carbine entered service with a straight 15-round magazine, but the introduction of the M2 carbine in October 1944 brought into service the curved 30-round box magazine. After WWII, the 30-round magazine quickly became the standard magazine for both the M1 and M2 carbines, although the 15-round magazine remained in service until the end of the Vietnam War.

30 round magazine for the M1A1 Carbine, chambered for .30-60 Springfield.\n The M1 carbine entered service with a straight 15-round magazine, but the introduction of the M2 carbine in October 1944 brought into service the curved 30-round box magazine. After WWII, the 30-round magazine quickly became the standard magazine for both the M1 and M2 carbines, although the 15-round magazine remained in service until the end of the Vietnam War.
10 round magazine for the M1 Carbine, modified to load .357 ammunition.
20 round magazine for the M1 Carbine, modified to load .357 ammunition.

15 round magazine for the M1 Carbine, modified to load 5.7x28mm. As part of modifications from 5.7x33 spitfire parts to this current carbine, adjustments were made to facilitate the reliable feeding of 5.7x28 rounds.

30 round magazine for the M1 Carbine, modified to load 5.7x28mm. As part of modifications from 5.7x33 spitfire parts to this current carbine, adjustments were made to facilitate the reliable feeding of 5.7x28 rounds.
